reviews.content:
Same concept of escape from prison..
Can watch for action sequences..
One time watchable movie..!!
Truly truly awful. Nothing redeeming what so ever. Save your time go watch some paint dry

reviews.review_title: Better fight choreography than John Wick 3 But...
reviews.content: Its still a poor imitation of the original.Stallone is looking good and back with a vengeance but not even he can save this retread.Hades was hell on earth , this is slightly better than the second one but not by much!
It is hard to outdo part one. Maybe if they had not killed of Vincent in part one. Who know though.

reviews.review_title: Predictable plot but still a good action movie.
reviews.content: This is your basic rescue movie. The action is good and the filmography and stunts are done well. If you enjoy action movies, this one is worth watching.
Not bad action, but too much of the film was spoken in Chinese with no subtitles. Couldn't get the gist of what they were talking about, stupid.

reviews.review_title: Escape plan with easy come out !
reviews.content: If you are expecting this is another escape theme movie from Sylvester Stallone then you will be disappointing, because it only an average action movie. Thrill of escaping from difficult prison is missing here. But here you will get bonus of martial arts sequences of Jin Zhang. Yes, Jin Zhang, that talented martial art actor (known for Grandmaster, IP man3 and Kill Zone 2 with Tony Jaa and Jing Wu), who did better work than Rambo here. Stallone and Dave are fighting as usual. Story is simple and straight divided in two parts, one kidnapping of daughter of rich technical security expert and second one for freed her from kidnapper's prison (?). Movie is average only watchable for some (only a litter word is better) fight sequences of Rambo and Dave and extra bonanza of Jin Jhang. Otherwise movie can be skipped out. Just watchable for once but not so expectations.

A Stallone film I haven't seen? What, it's already part 3. How did those two first parts go unnoticed? Well, I decided to watch it anyway. The backstory was left a bit mystery...but how complicated can an action flick be?Ok, well...this was not a very fun movie. It starts quite slow, like some agent/detective thriller. Most of the movie is the villain doing villainous things and the heroes planning to go to rescue. The overall tone is somehow cold, and most of the movie seemed depressing to me. I mean, the last two installments in Rambo series were also violent and pessimistic but managed also to be entertaining action flicks. But this one pretty much not. I believe there may be fans to this kind of gritty violent thrillers that abstain the cheesiness of "fun" action films. But probably this one isn't particularly great even in that department. Me personally started to wish I was watching some 80s action movie instead.Alonside Stallone we have many side characters. Dave Bautista plays Stallones ally, a big dude with a giant shotgun on his shoulder. When he started diving to action I thought he's cooler than Stallone - finally the movie is getting good! Too bad he was there only briefly. Then there's martial arts guy Jin Zhang who does some great fighting and almost steals the show as the main hero.I have one more complaint. The camerawork was often too shaky. Freehand cam is ok if it's used wisely (or if you're an amateur just doing movies for fun) but this was one of those movies where it seems like the camera must be shaking all the time, even in slow scenes when people are just talking. I don't get what's the appeal in that.Overall not a terrible movie but...not good either. The only reasons to watch: the novelty of it being Stallone, Bautista shooting shotgun in a short scene, and the several martial arts scenes.

Waste of time, too much loud music and the story line was trash but good try. Just stop making these, the first one was amazing and now they keep trying. They should have went to different prisons and fed off the first one. Garbage

The CGI in Escape Plan: The Extractors is so incredibly and undeniably horrific, that at one point, the blood gushing out of one of the characters is PURPLE!!! Was rendering red blood too expensive for the movie's extremely modest budget, or was it just fourth-rate junky work? I guess we'll never know.Apart from this movie's horrendous effects, relative to Escape Plan 2: Hades, Escape Plan: The Extractors is actually pretty decent and an improvement on its predecessor, though really that doesn't mean much, however in isolation, this movie is still a loosely put together film that makes it to its end barely in one piece.The most prominent improvement from the second installment was this movie's action sequences, which were far superior and entertaining, with Dave Bautista and (Max) Zhang Jin displaying some rather impressive final fights, while the story's more grounded nature proved to be more engaging and coherent, albeit still flimsy and inept, especially with how Ray seemed to have lost the energy he had at the end of Hades to hunt down the organization behind these underground prisons, everyone having their own separate plans in motion during the escape, and Bao Yung the bodyguard's presence and story being so abruptly abandoned. To be fair though I suppose, the imagery shown during the credits, which is not a post-credit scene however, sheds some light, though confusing, on his current status, while hinting a possible sequel, which hopefully will never happen, and should never happen.Even with its horrid CGI, Escape Plan: The Extractors is better than Hades, which admittedly was a welcomed surprise, with a better story and better action, but it is still tremendously inferior to the original.4.3/10.
I won't recommend anyone to watch because it's not worth of your time. The plot is not likely nothing that connects the title of movie actually . Better be not watch

Marginally better than The Escape Plan II, though that really isn't saying much. Why did they bother making a third after such a poorly-received second instalment?Anyway, in The Extractors (aka Escape Plan III) Sylvester Stallone's crew are breaking into a prison this time - an old, desolate one in Eastern Europe, where the bad guy is making things personal - rather than getting someone out. Lots of bloody violence and Stallone ends the movie as he ends most of them: looking like he's been through the ringer but still walking tall and resolute, dang it.Would have been best to stop after the excellent first Escape Plan. That was fun. The sequels? Not so much.

But I enjoyed it. I dig the Chinese badasses as well as the villains, and of course Bautista!! Dave is always fun to watch and his acting is getting better. Yea, like Dwayne Johnson and Statham, their sardonic lines get cheesy. But they are in fact screen badasses!
This movie keeps you interested, and in my book, if a movie does that, it's worth a 6 or 7. Some movies you just have to dismiss their art value and enjoy them with all their flaws.

reviews.review_title: An OK action film. Nothing more.
reviews.content: Simply put its watchable but nothing that good. Its a cheap looking direct to DVD generic action film. It has a simple rescuing hostages plot that makes the film a breaking into prison film rather than breaking out. Stallone and Dave Bautista do what they can with the material. 50 Cent is advertised as a lead but is only in it for 5 minutes or so. The thing I got a kick out of is the run time. Take out the end credits and the opening logos and the film only runs about 75 minutes. The end credits go very slow and put little bits of the film in there to boost the run time to 88 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Seems like it was made in one day!
reviews.content: I see myself as one of the biggest Stallone fans there is, and Sly is a huge role model of mine, but I seriously have no idea what the heck this movie was! As I say that I can hear Stallones voice in my head barking "It's a F-in' Extraction!" The first movie of this series I thought was incredible. It had suspense and cleverness, and almost had magician type escape-artist elements to it. The 3rd instalment of the Escape Plan franchise offers none of that. It's just like Sly was walking around his house bored one day muttering to himself "I'm Ray Breslin, I'm Ray Breslin, I'm Ray Breslin! Ray Breslin wants to kick some @$$!!!" It's just another movie about the good guys kicking @$$ and saving the girl! I give it 6/10 just because I like Stallone so much.

reviews.review_title: A simply cracking action no brainer
reviews.content: Ok so if you're looking for a similar experience as the first, you will be disappointed, firstly because its short, very short, this hampers its ability to really connect, secondly it lack the budget and finesse that the first had.If you're looking for something to wash away the sour taste of the second, well then it kinda helps in that respect.One thing that this has over the second is way more Stallone, and not just just any Stallone, the blood of Rambo is coursing through his veins, and it packs a punch, several to the gut in fact. Stallone's performance was for me the highlight, brutal and honest.Then added to the mix is Dave Bautista, who has a few brief but enjoyable moments to shine, and on top of that is some sublime martial arts moments, non more so that Jin Zhang and Daniel Bernhardt's almost dance like fight.50 Cent was also there very briefly, near the beginning.Over all its a distilled shot of action that burns bright and fades fast. I just wished there was a little more of it, especially after being force fed the long drawn out bland gruel that was the second film.On a final note, ignore the bad reviews, and give it a go, you might be surprised, I was.

Watched this and the 2nd one in one night and now I've wasted more than 3 hours of my life to this!The problem I had with this film was that they had to force the plot so much! They showed clips of the first films protagonist because nobody remembered who it was and didn't care! Then the bring his son in to cast revenge but the plan is weak asf, they had 2 of the chinese guys, who were breaking the kidnapped woman, in their captive but yet didn't kill them? They don't know who they are what so ever, so why not kill them?The film is just filled with errors for example the henchmen shoot one of their captive and show his blood on the floor, then they drag him and there's no trail? Sloppy! Stallone literally uses a flash light all the time in the tunnels, if I can see, you can see mate! In the tunnels or just after, Stallone sets up his flash light to be on strobe and has a guy walk through the door and investigate it, the other henchman then closes the door behind him and starts to get into a better position till Stallone goes through a different doorway next to the very same door and jams a pole through his head, what is the point of the first door? It's next to a doorway which leads to the same place and which no one saw before!In the "big" final fight scene, Stallone gets shot and it looks like it's hit his eye as there's a lot of blood there, next scene when Stallone goes into hand to hand combat, no blood on his eye? If you're going to make a film then don't piss off the audience with cheap film making, be consistent with what's just happened at least! Also Stallone is like 70 I swear, how is no one kicking his arse?At the very end there's a scene where the bodyguard jumps out of a pipe into the tunnel and then falls to the ground, what on earth does that add to the film?! Nothing at all! Please don't say it's to set up another film and somehow he is the new protagonist!! I started to watch the credit scenes at the end and there is just huge text behind whoever is on the screen for instance with the director, the text just reads director? Seems like more attention was put on the end credits than the actual film!Also how many producers do you need? I think I saw 10 at least? None of them said anything like "why are we doing this" 10 producers and still a bad film!

Contains Spoilers:Apart from a few decent martial arts fight sequences, the rest of the movie sucked.As a fan of 80s and 90s action flicks, I look forward to seeing newer movies with those action stars, but this one was truly disappointing.The story line was incohesive and all over the place, with some parts truly unrealistic. The bad guy's goal didn't make sense. He kidnapped a Chinese business tycoon's daughter and her assistants so that he can hack into the business and take it over and "break him" as some sort of a revenge plot. Why would he also kidnap Stallone character's girlfriend at the same time as revenge as well, when that would just cause Stallone's character to come out to Latvia to look for her and possibly ruin the original plan of ruining the Chinese business tycoon.The good guys had to break into the hellish prison, but there was no break in involved. Two ran through the front lawn that had explosives and got caught right away. The other just walked in through the sewers which they just happened to have a blueprint for on their computer (remote old prison in Latvia which likely wouldn't have digitized prison sewer blueprints).During few scenes when the main bad guy in the prison yelled "lock them up," the locking clunk sounded like a modern automatic locking system for all cell block doors at once. But yet the cell doors were individual type that they still had to use keys for.In one scene Bautista's character is shown walking inside the prison, but it's unclear how he got there, bypassing security and cameras.In another scene one of the Asian heroes used a taser to start a fire from chipped stone in his prison cell. In a fight scene between the Asian hero and a bad guy, I thought the bad guy was the main bad guy, but it wasn't. They just looked alike.Shows you how easy it is to not pay attention, and lose track to what's happening due to a poor story line. It's a big boring mess. Watch it for the cheesiness but don't get too exited.

reviews.review_title: You will turn off after 10 minutes boring as hell

Every now and then you watch a movie and afterwards you want to ask the director and the crew; did you watch this yourself? Really? Didn't you think a single time: whoa, let's stop shining those flashlight into the camera? What is it with that over-use of flashlights anyway?
That really annoyed me and it turned out to be representative for the directing of the whole movie.Story is poor. Like the most basic revenge story you can come up with, and than have it told by a little kid.
Main setting is supposedly "a hell of the worst kind" and "a maze". But it turns out to be just a poorly maintained prison that's everything short of a maze; people just walk in and out and have no problem or whatsoever to find each other. Showing only four or five rooms and a corridor doesn't give you a maze-feeling either.
Lots of those little things that shows nobody cared. How does it make sense that only once you're in the "maze", you think it might be a good idea to load your shotgun? Good for you that nobody saw you coming. You know, being in a heavily guarded maze and such...Acting is very lazy, except for Stallone maybe. He tries to hard, like he's trying to save more than his girlfriend. A movie, for instance.
Scenes with Bautista are specially hard to watch. Looks like he has to do this because of contractual obligations, certainly not because he wants to.A disappointment.
It is the film's worst disgrace that the director has brought out non-motivating events in the history of a famous actor such as Sylvester
Casting hispanics as asians? Getting casts who can speak real mandarin to play as a huge Chinese company's boss? Lazy scriptwriting, bad plot and extremely uneducated casting.

reviews.review_title: Decent action, but the casting of actors that can't speak their native Chinese is super annoying
reviews.content:
First, this is my first watching the Escape Plan franchise movie (I didn't even know about them, until I saw the trailer in the DVD I rented from Netflix. I have to say the action scenes are pretty good. I did enjoy the intensity and choreography of it.What super annoys me about the movie is the actors hired that are supposed to be Chinese from China. I know most of the moviegoers will never pick it up, unless they study Chinese a bit in high school or college, or they are actually fluent Chinese speakers. But the fact that you have actors that are playing the part of Chinese investors from China, and the Chinese employees that works for that corporations, and they can't even speak Chinese well enough to pass for native speakers? That is just lazy casting. I can understand if these actors can't speak English well, because that it literally their second or third language, it would actually be believable. But the actress that played Daya Zhang (Malese Jow) spoke fluent English, but I have to try really hard to translate her horrible Chinese pronunciation (the movie would be way better off using voice over on her Mandarin Chinese lines). Considering there are literally a billion Chinese people on this planet, plenty of them are fluent in both English and Chinese.
Obviously if the action movie star hired can't speak their Chinese lines fluently I can at least understand. Use voice actors for the few Chinese lines they have to say in the movie, and the movie will be even more awesome and authentic. Just saying, listening to horrible foreign language by supposedly native speakers is like hearing nails on the chalkboard.

Sly please change your wig. It is ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: More of a hostage flick than a prison escape.
reviews.content: As explained in the title, this is more of a hostage film where Breslin has to rescue his team mates once again, but unlike the 2nd (which is also horrible), this is just...well, horrible. Nothing really to do with escaping a prison, (even if it yet again takes place in a prison),but more to do with Rambo killing everyone in the way. Can in fact see a lot of similarities between Rambo: Last Blood (2019) and this, strays from that with the standard son of former friend (of main character) wants revenge plot. You can also tell that the writers and Sly knew this might be last one in series, predictable stuff happens.

I think this is an average action movie. some good special effects, when someone fires a gun. maybe I liked a bit more of one of the older Escape Plan movies, where the story was based mostly on Ray Breslin, when he was locked in a maximum security prison. for that movie, I would rate it 7/10, but this one only 6/10.

It's a real treat to see director John Herzfeld and Sly working together on this film. Two long time friends with a rich history creating a film brutally honest to its genre. They put their heart in, and it shows. Fight choreography was great. Plus it was filmed in the same prison that Shawshank Redemption used for some of its scenes. This should keep fans happy and ready for more.
